meanings.definition: Work excessively hard or too much.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overtoil herself by working late into the night.
meanings.sent2: I overtoil myself every day trying to meet unrealistic deadlines.
meanings.sent3: After a long day of overtoiling, she fell asleep at her desk.
meanings.sent4: The machine overtoiled, struggling to keep up with the demand.
meanings.sent5: His dedication to overtoiling often leads to burnout.

meanings.definition: Exhaust oneself with too much labor.
meanings.sent1: He would overtoil in the fields until the sun went down.
meanings.sent2: It's easy to overtoil when you're passionate about your work.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly complained about overtoiling her brain with math problems.
meanings.sent4: The old car engine overtoiled, emitting smoke and sputtering.
meanings.sent5: The marathon runner overtoiled himself, collapsing at the finish line.
